title: AB 1228
content: The State of California enacts the following. Section 66019.3 of the Education Code is amended to encourage dissemination of information to foster care agencies by California colleges and universities regarding admissions requirements and financial aid. The Regents of the University of California and the Trustees of the California State University are requested to explore using admissions-by-exemption to help homeless and foster youth transition into higher education. Section 76010 of the Education Code is also amended. Section 76010 of the Education Code is amended to prioritize housing for current and former homeless youth and foster youth at California Community Colleges, providing them with stable housing at no extra cost during academic breaks. Each campus of the California Community Colleges is required to develop a plan to ensure housing resources for current and former homeless youth and foster youth, regardless of student housing facilities. A "homeless youth" is defined as a student under 25 years old verified as homeless within the past 24 months by specific entities. The Education Code is amended to include provisions for housing resources for homeless youth and foster youth. It specifies who can verify a student as a former homeless youth and states that this status is retained for six years from admission. Section 90001.5 of the Education Code is amended to prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for student housing at California State University campuses. Housing facilities open year-round must first accommodate these students at no extra cost during breaks, followed by prioritizing them for housing with the most occupancy days in a year. Each California State University campus is required to develop a plan to provide housing resources for current and former homeless youth and foster youth, ensuring access during academic breaks. Homeless youth are defined as students under 25 who have been verified as homeless within the past 24 months by specific entities. The Education Code is amended to include provisions for housing resources for homeless youth and foster youth at California State University campuses. The status of a former homeless youth is retained for six years from the date of admission. Section 92660 of the Education Code is amended to prioritize current and former homeless youth and foster youth for student housing at University of California campuses, providing them with stable housing at no extra cost during academic breaks. A campus of the University of California is required to develop a plan to ensure that current and former homeless youth and foster youth have access to housing resources during academic breaks. Homeless youth are defined as students under 25 who have been verified as homeless within the past 24 months. The section specifies that certain individuals, including the director of federal TRIO programs and financial aid administrators, are eligible to verify a student as a former homeless youth for a period of six years. The University of California is exempt from this section unless the Regents choose to apply it.
